comments.summary: Check for the existence of a binary

structure.description: Check for the existence of a binary
name: @example
```js
import { checkForBinaryWithCancel } from 'bloodline'
import { fork } from 'fluture'
fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
checkForBinaryWithCancel(
cancellationFn,
'gvpr',
['-V'],

comments.summary: Check for multiple binaries in a single call

structure.description: Check for multiple binaries in a single call
name: @example
```js
import { checkForBinaries } from 'bloodline'
import { fork } from 'fluture'
fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
checkForBinaries(
cancellationFn,
'/usr/bin',
{ gvpr: ['-V'], dot: ['-V'] }

comments.summary: Generate a dependency tree, given a config, a directory, and a filename

structure.description: Generate a dependency tree, given a config, a directory, and a filename
name: @example
```js
import { plant } from 'bloodline'
const tree = plant({}, '../..', '../monocle/cli.js')

comments.summary: Test whether a path includes `'node_modules'` within it.

structure.description: Test whether a path includes `'node_modules'` within it.
name: @example
```js
import { isNodeModule } from 'bloodline/tree'
isNodeModule('./node_modules/ramda') // true

comments.summary: Test whether a path includes `'.git'` within it.

structure.description: Test whether a path includes `'.git'` within it.
name: @example
```js
import { isGitPath } from 'bloodline/tree'
isGitPath('.git/config') // true

comments.summary: Grab an id from a cache if possible

structure.description: Grab an id from a cache if possible
name: @example
```js
import { getId } from 'bloodline/tree'
const basePath = '..'
const cache = {}
const key = 'a'
console.log(getId(basePath, cache, key)) // 'bloodline/a'

comments.summary: Automatically create many of the fundamentals needed to build robust CLI tools, including help text.

future: meal: 'Pass the name of the meal you want',
multiplier: 'How many units should we apply?'
// closured so that we can pass cwd at runtime
"  	Pass the name of the meal you want",
"  	How many units should we apply?",

comments.summary: Merge two file representations. Can be right or left associative

signature: const a = { a: true, greeting: 'hello', comments: ['one', 'two'], links: ['a', 'b'] }
const b = { b: true, greeting: 'ahoy', comments: ['three', 'four'], links: ['c', 'd'] }

comments.summary: Check to see if a comment has an example within its structure.

structure.description: Check to see if a comment has an example within its structure.
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(hasExample({structure: {example: [`test=true`]}})).toBeTruthy()
expect(hasExample({})).toBeFalsy()
expect(hasExample('zipzop')).toBeFalsy()

comments.summary: Pull all imports from a given file, including `@curried` examples

structure.description: Pull all imports from a given file, including `@curried` examples
name: @example
```js test=true
const file = { comments: [
structure: { curried: [
{ name: 'coolWithConfig', lines: ['test=true'] },
{ name: 'cool', lines: ['test=true'] }
structure: { name: 'otherFunc', example: ['test=true'] }
expect(getImportsForTests(file)).toEqual(['otherFunc', 'coolWithConfig', 'cool'])

comments.summary: matchLinks  @example ```js test=true expect(matchLinks([])).toEqual([]) expect(matchLinks([`{@link cool}`])).toEqual(['cool']) ```

structure.description: matchLinks  @example ```js test=true expect(matchLinks([])).toEqual([]) expect(matchLinks([`{@link cool}`])).toEqual(['cool']) ```

comments.summary: Grab the summary from raw lines, given some indices to slice

structure.description: Grab the summary from raw lines, given some indices to slice
name: @example
```js test=true
const rawLines = [
' * @pageSummary Hey cool this is a multi-line',
' * description of stuff in the whole file',
' * @page testPageSummary',
' * @huh notSure'
expect(
getPageSummary(rawLines, Infinity, 0)
).toEqual([
'Hey cool this is a multi-line',
'description of stuff in the whole file'
expect(
getPageSummary([' * hey', ' * there'], Infinity, 0)
).toEqual(['hey', 'there'])

comments.summary: Is it an asterisk with maybe some whitespace around it?

structure.description: Is it an asterisk with maybe some whitespace around it?
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(isAsterisky('     * ')).toBeTruthy()
expect(isAsterisky('*')).toBeTruthy()
expect(isAsterisky('obelisk')).toBeFalsy()

comments.summary: stripEmptyCommentLines  @example ```js test=true expect(stripEmptyCommentLines('     *')).toEqual('') expect(stripEmptyCommentLines('hooray!')).toEqual('hooray!')

structure.description: stripEmptyCommentLines  @example ```js test=true expect(stripEmptyCommentLines('     *')).toEqual('') expect(stripEmptyCommentLines('hooray!')).toEqual('hooray!')

comments.summary: Grab the example from raw lines and some indices to slice

structure.description: Grab the example from raw lines and some indices to slice
structure.name: getExample

comments.summary: Given a line within a magic comment block, remove the leading asterisks

structure.description: Given a line within a magic comment block, remove the leading asterisks
name: @example
```js test=true
import { MAGIC_COMMENT_START as START, MAGIC_COMMENT_END as END } from '../constants'
// drgen-import-above
expect(stripLeadingComment('     ' + START)).toEqual('')
expect(stripLeadingComment(END)).toEqual('')
expect(stripLeadingComment(' * hey cool!')).toEqual('hey cool!')

comments.summary: objectifyComments

structure.description: objectifyComments

comments.summary: Process comments given a processor and an error handler

structure.description: Process comments given a processor and an error handler
name: @example
```js test=true
const input = Math.round(Math.random() * 1e3)
expect(
processComments(() => 'huh?', {process: y => y * 2}, input)
).toEqual(input * 2)
const fn = jest.fn()
processComments(fn, false, input)
expect(fn).toHaveBeenCalled()

comments.summary: Return the number of arguments a function expects

structure.description: Return the number of arguments a function expects
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(arity((a,b,c) => {})).toEqual(3)
expect(arity(function tertiary(a,b,c) {})).toEqual(3)
expect(arity(a => b => c => c)).toEqual(1)
expect(arity('poo')).toEqual(-1)

```js
import { localize } from 'file-system'
console.log(`support ${localize('business')}`)
// support ./business

comments.summary: groupByIndex  @example ```js test=true expect(groupByIndex(0, [ ['spades', 'ace'], ['diamonds', 'seven'], ['hearts', 'eight'], ['clubs', 'jack'], ['diamonds', 'ace'], ['spades', 'king'], ['diamonds', 'four'], ['spades', 'eight'], ])).toEqual({ clubs: [['jack']], diamonds: [['seven'], ['ace'], ['four']], hearts: [['eight']], spades: [['ace'], ['king'], ['eight']], }) ```

structure.description: groupByIndex  @example ```js test=true expect(groupByIndex(0, [ ['spades', 'ace'], ['diamonds', 'seven'], ['hearts', 'eight'], ['clubs', 'jack'], ['diamonds', 'ace'], ['spades', 'king'], ['diamonds', 'four'], ['spades', 'eight'], ])).toEqual({ clubs: [['jack']], diamonds: [['seven'], ['ace'], ['four']], hearts: [['eight']], spades: [['ace'], ['king'], ['eight']], }) ```

comments.summary: groupFlatByIndex  @example ```js test=true expect(groupFlatByIndex(0, [ ['spades', 'ace'], ['diamonds', 'seven'], ['hearts', 'eight'], ['clubs', 'jack'], ['diamonds', 'ace'], ['spades', 'king'], ['diamonds', 'four'], ['spades', 'eight'], ])).toEqual({ clubs: ['jack'], diamonds: ['seven', 'ace', 'four'], hearts: ['eight'], spades: ['ace', 'king', 'eight'], }) ```

structure.description: groupFlatByIndex  @example ```js test=true expect(groupFlatByIndex(0, [ ['spades', 'ace'], ['diamonds', 'seven'], ['hearts', 'eight'], ['clubs', 'jack'], ['diamonds', 'ace'], ['spades', 'king'], ['diamonds', 'four'], ['spades', 'eight'], ])).toEqual({ clubs: ['jack'], diamonds: ['seven', 'ace', 'four'], hearts: ['eight'], spades: ['ace', 'king', 'eight'], }) ```

comments.summary: Generic comparison function. This can be used to create a number of other more complex functions.

structure.description: Generic comparison function. This can be used to create a number of other more complex functions.
name: @example
```js test=true
const productIdSelector = z => {
const d = z.indexOf('-')
return d > -1 ? z.slice(0, d) : 'NO_MATCH'
const isProduct = equalishBy(productIdSelector, 'coolco')
expect(isProduct('coolco-10020')).toBeTruthy()
expect(isProduct('otherco-xkswn')).toBeFalsy()
expect(isProduct('blabbo')).toBeFalsy()

comments.summary: Call external processes and consume them as a Future-wrapped value. This is a light wrapper around `execa`, so please see [execa](https://github.com/sindresorhus/execa)'s documentation for more info.

structure.description: Call external processes and consume them as a Future-wrapped value. This is a light wrapper around `execa`, so please see [execa](https://github.com/sindresorhus/execa)'s documentation for more info.

comments.summary: Consume external commands as a Future-wrapped value.

structure.description: Consume external commands as a Future-wrapped value.
curried: 1. execWithConfig - Passes all possible configuration values plus a cancellation function.
2. execWithCancel - Eschews any configuration and instead only expects a cancellation function, command and arguments.
3. exec - Eschews any configuration or cancellation function. Needs only command and arguments.

comments.summary: Add an `ora` indicator to a Future

structure.description: Add an `ora` indicator to a Future
structure.name: signal

comments.summary: Slice a string by counted delimiters

structure.description: Slice a string by counted delimiters
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(
nthIndex('/', -5, 'a/b/c/d/e/f/g/h/i/j')
).toEqual("f/g/h/i/j")
expect(
nthIndex('/', 5, 'a/b/c/d/e/f/g/h/i/j')
).toEqual("a/b/c/d/e")

comments.summary: A simple memoized utility for repeating a string and joining the array.

structure.description: A simple memoized utility for repeating a string and joining the array.
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(strepeat('=', 5)).toEqual('=====')
expect(strepeat('/', -1)).toEqual('')

comments.summary: Take PascalCase and kebabCase inputs and replace them with slug-case

structure.description: Take PascalCase and kebabCase inputs and replace them with slug-case
name: @example
```js test=true
expect(slugWord('CoolFuckingShit')).toEqual('cool-fucking-shit')
expect(slugWord('hoorayNiceLife')).toEqual('hooray-nice-life')
expect(slugWord('Do nothingCool ever')).toEqual('do nothing-cool ever')
expect(
slugWord('src/components/homepage/AugmentedDetailsDumbComponent')
).toEqual(
'src-components-homepage-augmented-details-dumb-component'

name: @example

const plugin = {
name: 'get-const',
fn: (state, file, { any }) => any(/const/)
export default plugin

comments.summary: Summarize a project, given: - the path to a `package.json` file - the path to a `dr-generated.json` file - the URI of a documentation site - the URI of a repository - (optional) a banner - or (optional) the path to a file which represents a banner

structure.description: Summarize a project, given: - the path to a `package.json` file - the path to a `dr-generated.json` file - the URI of a documentation site - the URI of a repository - (optional) a banner - or (optional) the path to a file which represents a banner
structure.name: summarize
future: " * [monocle](//repo.biz/packages/monocle) - inspect code and apply rules, magically ",
" * [eslint-config-monoculture](//repo.biz/shared/eslint-config-monoculture) - shared eslint configuration for monoculture packages ",
" * [jest-config](//repo.biz/shared/jest-config) - shared jest configuration for monoculture packages ",
" * [digested](//repo.biz/tools/digested) - summarize and automatically generate information about your projects ",
" * [doctor-general-cli](//repo.biz/tools/doctor-general-cli) - documentation generation in a nice CLI ",
" * [gitparty](//repo.biz/tools/gitparty) - visualize git logs with magical context ",
" * [superorganism](//repo.biz/tools/superorganism) - script runner from beyond the moon ",
" * [treacle](//repo.biz/tools/treacle) - command line interface tree visualization pun ",
